channel.title: Breakdown of item.cfg
channel.description:
Okey dokey, you see, I'm trying to convert item.cfg into XML, but the problem is, I don't know the structure. Can somebody explain what each field means in the following line of item.cfg:
[code]item = 3202 Rune_halberd A_rune_halberd. 40176.4538861148 40176.4538861148 52221.5130936656 48 67 0 -4 0 -1 4 5 0 0 68 0[/code]
I got the item = 3202 Rune_halberd A_rune_halberd part down, but what about the rest?
Thank you, ~io9`

+98 (I believe)
The whip only gives +82 without any other bonuses.

item.title: Breakdown of item.cfg
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Well, pretend you had a piece of armor that had high slash defense. This means that if a person’s attacking weapon had a large slash attack and they were using their weapons slash attack, it would barely damage you. Now, if your armor had a low slash defense and their weapon had a high slash, then they could do a lot more damage and would hit you more often if they used their slash attack.

The strength bonus at the bottom is for increasing total strength when doing damage. The abyssal whip, +98 (I believe) strength + your current strength (say 80) would make a powerful combination. This means that if your weapon has a good attack and corresponding attack bonus that your opponent’s armor does not have, you will hit tremendous damage of 168 possible strength.

The prayer bonus at the bottom usually does not go very high, but it is very effective. Only a +11 prayer will make your prayers last a load longer than normal.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakdown of item.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Archbishop Archbishop
item.description:
@Archbishop wrote:

Well, you could look at any weapon in existance or armor and find out that the first 5 bonuses are for attack, and next 5 are for defence, and the next 2 are Strength and Prayer.
Heck, the example you posted should be obvious enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakdown of item.cfg
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:4, topic:134498”]

So that means the 0’s represent each item as follows:

Stab
Slash
Crush
Magic
Range
Stab
Slash
Crush
Magic
Range
Strength
Prayer

It might be a bit different, but I think it is that.[/quote]
Which Stab/Slash/Crush/etc. is which? Attack or defense?

Read full topic

item.title: Breakdown of item.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Brett2 Brett`
item.description:
@Brett2 wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:2, topic:134498”]Looking at the ItemHandler in a wL server, I found

	public void newItemList(int ItemId, String ItemName, String ItemDescription, double ShopValue, double LowAlch, double HighAlch, int Bonuses[]) {

I would imagine that bonuses array represents the combat bonuses for equipment items.[/quote]

That’s exactly what it is, but he might want which each of the bonsus is?

Read full topic
